page.title:
NWSChat
NWSChat
page.normal_text:
System for Instant Messaging (IM) between NWS and “Partners” for sharing warning decision expertise and other types of significant weather information essential to the NWS’ mission of saving lives and property.
System for Instant Messaging (IM) between NWS and “Partners” for sharing S y s t e m
f o r
I n s t a n t
M e s s a g i n g
( I M )
b e t w e e n
N W S
a n d
“ P a r t n e r s ”
f o r s h a r i n g
warning decision expertise and other types of significant weather
information essential to the NWS’ mission of saving lives and property.
page.enlisting:
• Provides media and emergency response partners with the ability to communicate significant event reports back to NWS operational personnel. • NWS partners use IM as an efficient means of seeking clarifications and enhancements to the communication stream originating from the NWS during a fast-paced significant weather or hydrologic event. • NWSChat enhanced feature (nwsbot) shows warnings/watches and other products issued by the WFO for a particular chatroom. • Provides media and emergency response partners with the ability to communicate significant event reports back to NWS operational personnel.
• Provides media and emergency response partners with the ability to
communicate significant event reports back to NWS operational personnel. c o m m u n i c a t e

page.title:
NWSChat
NWSChat
page.enlisting:
✓ NWSChat Experimental Period from 12/1/2008 to 12/15/2009 – ongoing. • NWSChat released for NWS accounts on 12 Nov. 2008 • NWSChat opened for external accounts on 1 Dec. 2008 • Use of other IM chat (IEM) terminated on 2 February 2009. • One year period allows for evaluation during all seasons and weather conditions. • Experimental product Service Description Document for NWSChat in place. ✓ Web site includes account request forms, draft Terms of Use, training, and draft policy information. Hardware and Software in place for system evaluation. ✓ NWSChat Experimental Period from 12/1/2008 to 12/15/2009 – ongoing.

NWSChat Status
NWSChat Status
page.enlisting:
✓ Over 5500 individual NWSChat accounts issued to date • NWS Participation: 2280 individual accounts – 117 WFOs – 10 RFCs – 15 CWSUs – 4 National Centers & WDTB • Media - 1313 accounts • EM/State/Other – 2006 accounts ✓ Over 5500 individual NWSChat accounts issued to date

page.title:
NWSChat – What’s Next?
NWSChat – What’s Next?
page.normal_text:
6 Month preliminary survey Comment end period: Final recommendation decision Final Operating Capability

page.enlisting:
• Continue use and evaluation of NWSChat • Plan to survey Regions for impact, with questions that will be used for Go/No-Go determination. • Review of comments and final survey results on system, policy and use at comment end period. • Continue use and evaluation of NWSChat
